abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey an unsatisfactory
            outcome, unlikely sustainability, and, unsatisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower, despite a modest
            institutional development impact. Lessons regarding project
            design reinforce the importance of clear project objectives,
            and operational arrangements, as well as particular
            attention to technical aspects, and managerial aspects,
            namely, financial, procurement, and monitoring issues.
            Although the project included substantial technical
            assistance (TA), it was confined to biodiversity, and other
            technical matters, rather that being paralleled with TA in
            managerial aspects, as mentioned above. Also reinforced is
            the need for an institutional capacity analysis of
            implementing agencies, at an early stage, to assess its
            strengths and weaknesses, and, where necessary, changes
            should be made to tailor the design to mitigate such
            weaknesses, and in turn, the agency should strengthen its
            capacity as needed. Investments in natural resources such as
            forestry, protected areas or watersheds, require continuous
            activity over an extended period of time. They do not lend
            themselves to being treated as projects, and may best be
            conceived as programs which would ensure the longer-term
            support required. This program could have been presented as
            two or more projects, in order to allow for stocktaking,
            including potential changes in project design between the
            various project phases. Moreover, credit schemes such as the
            project's Livelihood component, are typically quite
            difficult; credit in remote areas is extremely difficult due
            to lack of interest to provide small loans in these areas.
            Projects or components which have a mix of both credit, and
            grants are particularly difficult to operate. Lessons
            concerning implementation indicate that, an implementation
            which relies on the reimbursement of large numbers of
            Statements of Expenditures in remote locations, has inherent
            risks, and requires operation of appropriate mitigating
            mechanisms, a strong oversight capacity, and sampling for
            post review. The Mid Term Review provides an opportunity to
            ensure performance indicators, and as well, to restructure
            the project, if so required.
